result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey M. Thompson

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on January 6, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
ec: DA, Atty Nelson, DHS/MMHI; ae 10/21/22

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 9:03am.
Defendant Jeffrey M. Thomspon in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however Attorney Nelson raises competency concerns. 
The Court finds probable cause based on the four corners of the Complaint. 
The Court orders a competency examination to be conducted by the Department of Health Services.  
The Court informs the parties that a judicial rotation will occur before the January 6th hearing date. The Court directs Attorney Nelson to discuss with Mr. Thompson what that involves, and his right to substitution.   
recess 9:07am 

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Nelson is to submit a proposed order for competency examination,  (2) Competency Hearing on January 6th at 1:30pm

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 2:18pm 
Defendant Jeffrey M. Thompson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with the Victim
--to take prescription medications only as prescribed
recess 2:24pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add the Jefferson Public Defenders Office to the mailing matrix,   (2) Pretrial Conference on September 28th at 10:40am, (3) Preliminary Hearing on October 21st at 9:00am
